title: Calories in Tomato Soup
meta_description: Discover calories in tomato soup per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium details, and preparation tweaks for better nutrition.
assumptions: Canned, ready-to-eat tomato soup (e.g., standard variety like Campbell's), 1 cup serving (245 g), prepared as directed, no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe (canned vs. homemade), sodium level, and serving size. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One cup of tomato soup provides about 100 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of tomato soup?
faqs.a: Approximately 100 kcal for a standard canned serving.

faqs.q: Is tomato soup high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, often around 900 mg per cup due to canning; opt for low-sodium options.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in tomato soup?
faqs.a: About 19 g per cup, including 2 g fiber and 12 g sugars.
Typically 80-120 kcal per cup, depending on ingredients like oil or cream.

faqs.q: Does tomato soup have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Low in both: ~2 g protein and 1 g fat per cup.
